messages.title: GREEN WIN AS COUNCIL DUMPS WIRRAL VIEW
messages.content: Green councillors back move scrapping paper. Wirral council's controversial newspaper Wirral View has ceased publication.

messages.title: BREAKTHROUGH ON SAFER STREETS
messages.content: Council committed to '20’s plenty' pilot zone. We have all seen 20mph signs in some of our streets but not others.

messages.title: GRAFFITI GONE
messages.content: Council takes action after issues reported by Harry. Wirral Council has successfully removed Graffiti on the sub station at the end of Temple Road as well as on the street sign of St George's Gardens.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Campaigning for 20mph speed limits across all residential roads to improve safety for children and pedestrians.
Increase in tree planting in the wake of the Climate Emergency, with a goal to raise tree cover to at least 10% by 2030.

issues.environment: Increase tree planting in wake of Climate Emergency.

leaflet.personalStatement: My vision is a Birkenhead that is both prosperous and green.

politicalExperience.achievements: Raised the issue of one-party rule in Birkenhead, proposing to end the days of one-party rule.

images.caption: Harry and Chris with your General Election candidate Pat Cleary
Work has been going on for nearly 7 years
Harry inspects cleared graffiti on Temple Road

leaflet.additionalNotes: Pat Cleary has a proven track record for Birkenhead. Works hard all year round. Listens to local residents.
